raw.title: [BIP-663] Enable wUSDM/GYD E-CLP gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
PR with Payload:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1172

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wUSDM/GYD E-CLP on Arbitrum. We propose to only enable protocol fees once rewards start.



### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wUSDM is a wrapped version of USDM. USDM is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by the [Mountain Protocol](https://mountainprotocol.com/)
* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by the [Gyroscope protocol](https://gyro.finance/)
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is further expanding on Arbitrum and bootstrapping wUSDM/GYD liquidity on Arbitrum with the first respective pool.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
- 'rateProvider0': wUSDM rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x7F55E509006C9Df7594C4819Ba7ebfE6EfE4854b](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7F55E509006C9Df7594C4819Ba7ebfE6EfE4854b) and relevant [review](https://github.com/balancer/code-review/blob/main/rate-providers/wUSDMRateProvider.md).
-  'rateProvider1': GYD rate provider on Arbitrum: 0x00

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
- The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
- This is the first wUSDM/ GYD pool

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x315dd595e82bDc0c194f3A38A08fDE480D7E5d21](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x315dd595e82bDc0c194f3A38A08fDE480D7E5d21)
- Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x879049Df2744B8D8848985C82275AD4c07379905](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x879049Df2744B8D8848985C82275AD4c07379905)
- Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x9eCc698c20219Ea45697d82ca89cD044aEEACF60`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-615] Enable gauge for USDC/GYD & USDT/GYD [zkEVM]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1000

### Summary
This is a proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges for USDC/GYD and USDT/GYD E-CLPs on Polygon zkEVM. The pools are not yield-bearing.

---

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps#description-of-e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* GYD is a USD denominated meta-stablecoin with several design innovations that put risk control on autopilot. GYD is issued by the [Gyroscope](https://gyro.finance/) protocol. 
* USDT is a USD denominated stablecoin issued by [Tether](https://tether.to/en/).
* USDC is a USD denominated stablecoin issued by [Circle](https://www.circle.com/en/).

---

### Motivation
Gyroscope has expanded its GYD availability to zkEVM and created two core pools for a future liquidity network around GYD on zkEVM.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
 n/a

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
* USDC/ GYD
  *  E-CLP: [0xd4ec150896f1784b5be2b3af460d2cb2b8c0f522](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com//address/0xd4ec150896f1784b5be2b3af460d2cb2b8c0f522)
  * Childchain gauge on Polygon zkEVM: [0xB049896B3eDcea20dD92c94C706DC67EEa354e57](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0xB049896B3eDcea20dD92c94C706DC67EEa354e57)
  * Polygon zkEVM root gauge on Ethereum: [0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5)
 * USDT/ GYD
   * E-CLP: [0xF596ac9c9b60F9C555B8290c2b039C275396afb4](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0xf596ac9c9b60f9c555b8290c2b039c275396afb4)
   * Childchain gauge on Polygon zkEVM: [0x62AbD51DA1927ae9020264A31F31F07948f31213](https://zkevm.polygonscan.com/address/0x62AbD51DA1927ae9020264A31F31F07948f31213)
   * Polygon zkEVM root gauge on Ethereum: [0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985](https://etherscan.io/address/0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x8806BdF4D6aEB1E3b35bea43835abFAA601BC7b5`
> gaugeType(string): `PolygonZkEvm` 
> gauge(address): `0xab973781729714Cf85849C00A015615997325985`
> gaugeType(string): `PolygonZkEvm`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-620] Enable gauge for wstETH/WETH E-CLP [Gnosis]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1027

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wstETH/ WETH E-CLP on Gnosis Chain. 

E-CLP's asymmetric concentrated liquidity profile offers capital efficiency improvements. As per previous arrangements between Balancer and Gnosis this pool shall not bear any protocol fees for the time being.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wstETH is a wrapped version of stETH. [..] wstETH keeps your balance of stETH fixed and uses an underlying share system to reflect your staking rewards." - [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5231836-what-is-lido-s-wsteth)
* WETH is an ERC-20 compliant wrapper of ETH.
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is expanding to Gnosis Chain.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
-  'rateProvider0': WETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: 0x00
- 'rateProvider1': wstETH rate provider on Gnosis Chain: [0x09f9611FE9d24c6A518f656E925e3628A2ECDE3b](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x09f9611FE9d24c6A518f656E925e3628A2ECDE3b)
#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x8DD4df4Ce580b9644437f3375e54f1ab09808228](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x8DD4df4Ce580b9644437f3375e54f1ab09808228)
- Childchain gauge on Gnosis Chain: [0xa1fF1e44E4f8346398767f94ae7DbeAB71522164](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xa1fF1e44E4f8346398767f94ae7DbeAB71522164)
- Gnosis Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b](https://etherscan.io/address/0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x6d060a785530cB13795b3c5a43320c462811d43b`
> gaugeType(string): `Gnosis`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-641] Enable wstETH/WETH E-CLP gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1101

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable one uncapped Balancer gauge for a wstETH/WETH E-CLP on Arbitrum with Core Pool status.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of E-CLPs](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* "wstETH is a wrapped version of stETH. [..] wstETH keeps your balance of stETH fixed and uses an underlying share system to reflect your staking rewards." - [Lido](https://help.lido.fi/en/articles/5231836-what-is-lido-s-wsteth)
* WETH is an ERC-20 compliant wrapper of ETH.
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope is further expanding on Arbitrum. This pool is replacing a previously deployed E-CLP for the same assets and is calibrated to have a better fitting liquidity shape.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
- 'rateProvider0': wstETH rate provider on Arbitrum: [0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xf7c5c26B574063e7b098ed74fAd6779e65E3F836)
-  'rateProvider1': WETH rate provider on Arbitrum: 0x00

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
- The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
- wstETH and WETH already have markets on Balancer and other DEXes, but without the capital efficiency of an E-CLP.

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- E-CLP: [0x7967FA58B9501600D96bD843173b9334983EE6E6](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7967FA58B9501600D96bD843173b9334983EE6E6)
- Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x96d7C70c80518Ee189CB6ba672FbD22E4fDD9c19](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x96d7C70c80518Ee189CB6ba672FbD22E4fDD9c19)
- Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5](https://etherscan.io/address/0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5)

---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x3ABa56CeC68987963566a9AA93bb7f7DD28De3F5`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-642] Enable GYD/aUSDC and GYD/aUSDT Rehype gauges [Arbitrum]
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-642] Enable GYD/aUSDC and GYD/aUSDT Rehype gauges [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1102

### Summary 
This is a proposal to enable two uncapped Balancer gauges for (1) GYD/aUSDC and (2) GYD/aUSDT Rehype Pools on Arbitrum. 

Since Gyroscope is managing these pools instead of the Balancer DAO we propose to start with a protocol fee of 50%, but further explore decreasing the protocol fee to 30%. The protocol fee shall kick in as soon as rewards start. With a lower protocol fee LP yield can be sustainably increased, helping to bootstrap the specified Rehype Pools.

### References/Useful links
* [Documentation of Rehype Pools](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/concentrated-liquidity-pools/rehype-e-clps)
* [Website](https://gyro.finance/)
* [Github](https://github.com/gyrostable)
* [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2vnqnS7wE6)
* [X](https://twitter.com/GyroStable)

---

### Protocol description
* stataArbUSDT (or in short, aUSDT) is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDT on Arbitrum. - [Aave ](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)
* stataArbUSDCn (or in short, aUSDC) is the wrapped, static version of the rebasing Aave lending deposit token for aUSDC on Arbitrum. - [Aave ](https://github.com/bgd-labs/static-a-token-v3)
* GYD is a USD denominated stablecoin, issued by the [Gyroscope protocol](https://gyro.finance/)
---

### Motivation
Gyroscope wants to obtain the option to participate in voting markets for two previously deployed pools.

---

### Specifications
#### Governance
The Gyroscope Protocol will be governed by a DAO and relevant stakeholder with the full launch on Ethereum. For now, the FTL Labs multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee. As a custom pool by Gyroscope, the E-CLP will be controlled by Gyroscope governance upon its launch.

 #### Oracles
- aUSDC rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x87cD462A781c0ca843EAB131Bf368328848bB6fD](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x87cD462A781c0ca843EAB131Bf368328848bB6fD)
- aUSDT rate provider on Arbitrum: [0x48942b49b5bb6f3e1d43c204a3f40a4c5f696ef6](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x48942b49b5bb6f3e1d43c204a3f40a4c5f696ef6)
- GYD rate provider on Arbitrum: 0x00

#### Audits
Audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification can be accessed here (the E-CLP is called the “CEMM” in these reports). In addition, the E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

#### Centralization vectors
No centralization vectors. The FTL Labs team’s multi-sig can - currently - pause the pool, change the swap fee and set the protocol fee.

#### Market History
- The Gyroscope Protocol is live on Ethereum since EOY23, with E-CLPs on several other chains. Details available [here ](https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope-e-clps).
- The live [GYD/aUSDC pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x6e822c64c00393b2078f2a5bb75c575ab505b55c000200000000000000000548)
- The live [GYD/aUSDT pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0x7272163a931dac5bbe1cb5fefaf959bb65f7346f000200000000000000000549)

## Value
As per “Motivation”.

---

#### Contracts
- GYD/aUSDC Rehype Pool
  - Pool address: [0x6e822c64c00393b2078f2a5bb75c575ab505b55c](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x6e822c64c00393b2078f2a5bb75c575ab505b55c)
  - Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0x052597b6633814a0a6ea9020ee46e25aa6936e49](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x052597b6633814a0a6ea9020ee46e25aa6936e49)
  - Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0xd384F6aC540eFeF9378cf8F6453Ad38A696411b5](https://etherscan.io/address/0xd384F6aC540eFeF9378cf8F6453Ad38A696411b5)
- GYD/aUSDT Rehype Pool
  - Pool address: [0x7272163a931dac5bbe1cb5fefaf959bb65f7346f](https://arbiscan.io/address/0x7272163a931dac5bbe1cb5fefaf959bb65f7346f)
  - Childchain gauge on Arbitrum: [0xd9647eb5d6457bd7adb39b335ab89ec3a1ea6d09](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xd9647eb5d6457bd7adb39b335ab89ec3a1ea6d09)
  - Arbitrum Chain root gauge on Ethereum: [0x7E123aD65cc842AB93bf2Dc79A8eadE8975bd3Cb](https://etherscan.io/address/0x7E123aD65cc842AB93bf2Dc79A8eadE8975bd3Cb)
---

> Specification
>
> Transaction: The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments:
>
> gauge(address): `0x7E123aD65cc842AB93bf2Dc79A8eadE8975bd3Cb`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`
> gauge(address): `0xd384F6aC540eFeF9378cf8F6453Ad38A696411b5`
> gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: Proposal to enable a new uncapped Balancer gauge for the sUSDe/GYD E-CLP on Ethereum, supporting Gyroscope's liquidity network expansion. The vote shows unanimous early support and stability. Similar past proposals enabling gauges were successful. Forum sentiment is limited and slightly negative but does not outweigh strong voting consensus.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous early and stable support for enabling the gauge in voting timeline.
Similar past proposals enabling gauges were approved and had positive market/tvl impacts.
Proposal expands liquidity routes and protocol fees accrue fully to Balancer, enhancing protocol value.
No centralization vectors and audited code base with live production use on Polygon.
key_arguments_against: Limited negative sentiment in forum discussion expressing some concerns.
Recent market price and TVL impact post-vote is negative but not used for recommendation.

evidence.quote: Forum comments show one negative and one neutral sentiment post before proposal end.
Voting timeline shows full early ratio, stability, and unanimous lead for 'Yes, let's do it'.
Similar past proposals enabling gauges had positive market and TVL impacts and unanimous 'Yes' wins.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The voting timeline shows unanimous, early, and stable support for enabling the gauge, indicating strong voter consensus.
• Similar past proposals enabling new gauges had positive post-vote market and TVL impacts, suggesting this is a beneficial change for the protocol.
• Forum sentiment is limited and slightly negative but does not reflect the broad voter support; hence, the recommendation aligns with the vote rather than forum concerns.
• The proposal expands liquidity options and accrues protocol fees fully to Balancer, strengthening protocol value without introducing centralization risks.
